channel.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
channel.description:
Not everyone, but seriously. This is my first time posting on here, though I've played moparscape servers for several years. One of the reasons I haven't posted until now is because my post would be pointless. It would probably be locked or flamed. Almost every question or comment on this website gets that kind of response. I mean, I'll go to server development, just to see if there's anything interesting, and someone makes a post about how good there server is. Next post, "Wrong topic. Try learning to read before you use the forums again. Or maybe go to here (link to rules) and stop being such a moron." I also see a lot of, "Ever heard of using a search bar?" or, "Ever heard of the blah blah blah forum?" It's hard to post on this website at all without being flamed or locked. This thread is probably in the wrong section, so of course, I'll be flamed and then have it moved through 10 other types of forum topics that shouldn't even exist. Why dont they just compact more of the thread topics together, so that you don't have to be so careful about where you are when you post? Or at least stop being so uptight about every single one being perfectly organized...
That's about it.

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“jbblaze, post:47, topic:269331”][quote]I wouldn’t call that maturity either. He will end up the same way as his brothers no matter how much he tries to resist. He may be become more mature underneath, but he will still seem immature on the outside. That’s how all of us are.
[/quote]

Well that’s a little bit depressing. I understand, my 19 year old brother is actually really mature, always has been. Kinda a weird thing about him.
Anyway, I know it already says it in the rules to “use Google first” and “NO SPOONFEEDING” I don’t understand why people don’t get penalized for it. I think we need to get even stricter in order to get people to calm down and think.

And now thinking even further, how many private servers are REALLY successful? I understand there’s a million people looking to start a server. I think a forum like this is great, but we gotta get past just the “port forwarding stage” eventually right? Now Ive seen some pretty awesome guides and tuts that are great for the server but too many that say “how to add dialogue” and “how to make yourself admin”. Now I am a little bit stubborn, so I usually try to do everything myself. I didn’t come across moparscape till awhile after my server was up. So I learned the hard way how to port forward and make a web client and more and more. But at least now I know mostly what Im doing. Now i have loyal donators, a good webclient some nice players, a forum admin, mods, and I’m about to pay for a brand new VPS. Of course I used Google as help. But what I don’t understand is why people come here first, instead of Google. Google will come up with what moparscape has, and so much more :D.

My point is is that the forum maybe could become a little more advanced. Im not sure how much more we can do about it, but we gotta get people to just try.[/quote]

I agree, the success of a server is usually directly related to the amount of content that is in it. But the performance is a large factor, which is why Mopar has the entire Sponsored Servers thing going on now.

And about improving the website, if you get any ideas, make sure you post them in the suggestions sticky right away. I personally look forward to seeing all the ideas that people come up with.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is the community of this site so messed up?

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @jbblaze jbblaze
item.description:
@jbblaze wrote:

I wouldn't call that maturity either. He will end up the same way as his brothers no matter how much he tries to resist. He may be become more mature underneath, but he will still seem immature on the outside. That's how all of us are.

Well that’s a little bit depressing. I understand, my 19 year old brother is actually really mature, always has been. Kinda a weird thing about him.
Anyway, I know it already says it in the rules to “use Google first” and “NO SPOONFEEDING” I don’t understand why people don’t get penalized for it. I think we need to get even stricter in order to get people to calm down and think.

And now thinking even further, how many private servers are REALLY successful? I understand there’s a million people looking to start a server. I think a forum like this is great, but we gotta get past just the “port forwarding stage” eventually right? Now Ive seen some pretty awesome guides and tuts that are great for the server but too many that say “how to add dialogue” and “how to make yourself admin”. Now I am a little bit stubborn, so I usually try to do everything myself. I didn’t come across moparscape till awhile after my server was up. So I learned the hard way how to port forward and make a web client and more and more. But at least now I know mostly what Im doing. Now i have loyal donators, a good webclient some nice players, a forum admin, mods, and I’m about to pay for a brand new VPS. Of course I used Google as help. But what I don’t understand is why people come here first, instead of Google. Google will come up with what moparscape has, and so much more :D.

My point is is that the forum maybe could become a little more advanced. Im not sure how much more we can do about it, but we gotta get people to just try.

item.description:

And I also doubt that you yourself made an effort to use google and learn Java before coming here yourself, so why are you giving this piece of advice to others?

Partly becuase I spend more time at moparisthebst.

item.source: Why is the community of this site so messed up?

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:43, topic:269331”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=355441.msg2723288#msg2723288 date=1238121515]
Communities thrive with people who are kind and contributive to the well-being of the community. Sadly, there are almost no people that share both those qualities on these forums anymore.
[/quote]
Yeah I have that attitude on most other websites, but here it just doesn’t seem to work. Its actually a challenge to get along with some of the staff, and in fact I barely ever talk to them. If we could work as a team, a lot more would get done around here.[/quote]

I’ve never gotten along with the staff in its entirety, but I do the best I can.

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:39, topic:269331”][quote author=jbblaze link=topic=355441.msg2723316#msg2723316 date=1238123062]
First of all, I dont know if this is really server help.
I dont really care

Second. Welcome to the internet :D! Jerks are gonna be jerks, its the way of the world. No matter what you do, theres still gonna be some egotistical jerk, or some annoying idiot out there to make things seem messed up.

So you know what I would do? Shut em up :P. I am absolutely SURE that every single successful server owner out there have dealed with at least 100 morons or jerks. But the world keeps on spinning, and everyone learns someday (usually :P).

By the way, Im 12 I dont know if you can tell by sucky spelling or grammer but im in 6th grade, and Ive seen plenty of 16 year morons. You would think have “senority” over lower grades would make you more mature. Well something about senority that makes people think they have the right to be a jackass to youger kids.

Of course im not stereotyping, Because im not sure how im gonna be when im 16 I have 2 older brothers, one 19 and one 17 and there friends arent exactly “mature” most of mine arent either. Well sorry to keep rambling on, I hope ive proved some point

[/quote]A 12 year old thats more mature than a lot of 13-17 year olds on here? Doesn’t surprise me one bit.[/quote]

I wouldn’t call that maturity either. He will end up the same way as his brothers no matter how much he tries to resist. He may be become more mature underneath, but he will still seem immature on the outside. That’s how all of us are.

Fat Cookies:

Well the answer to that question is very simple, A large proportion of people are ignorant and dont even look at a single word in the rules. (these members often have little computer knowledge and expect to be spoonfed their way to the top). If you think its getting worse, thats because “some” staff have given up on constantly having to pester people just to make the site look ‘ok’. Last but not least, the main reason that this site is messed up is that www.google.com is not apprarent to several members. If every member made the effort to use google and learn java before moaning like a two year old the community would become a much more informative place.

Everyone is ignorant of something. For example, you are being ignorant of the fact that not everyone here is as ignorant and stupid as you portray them to be. And I also doubt that you yourself made an effort to use google and learn Java before coming here yourself, so why are you giving this piece of advice to others?

Read full topic

item.source: Why is the community of this site so messed up?

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Since I joined this community, it’s gotten a lot better. Why is it that every time I see it starting to peek to a point where it seems like everything is getting so much better, someone has to complain about how terrible it is. Half of the reason why “This community fails” is because no one looks forward to it’s future. If it’s so terrible, why don’t doesn’t everyone that rants about it try a little bit harder and contribute to the community rather than complaining. We’ve already established that a majority of the members here are immature, but by complaining about it you’re only making yourself look as low as them. I’ve tried to explain in a few threads my opinion on this subject, but no one even takes notice to it. Imo, I don’t see how anyone else can understand each other on the same level when they all want to get their own opinion across. Our problem is being selfish; everyone here wants to make some sort of name for themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:36, topic:269331”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=355441.msg2723151#msg2723151 date=1238115911]

The problem comes from too many young people. They’re not mature enough, and members from mitb think they’re illiterate retards. But they were the same back then. (Same for me, I was whiny little kid too.) It’s just too much to control a bunch of kids.

I may be only 12 but i should still be able to stay
[/quote]
Although most people see age as a factor, it is not a factor at all. A member’s maturity level is the real factor. A 16 year old may have the maturity level of an 11 year old, while the 11 year old may have the maturity level of a 16 year old. This community can thrive with a bunch of 10 year olds, only if they are mature enough. I would rather have a community full of mature 10 year olds than immature 16 year olds.[/quote]

People have natural maturity as they age. It’s their own choice whether or not they show it. People who are more serious tend to also be more mature, and vice versa for the more laid-back people. So really, a community would not thrive with a bunch of 10 year olds who “seem” mature. Communities thrive with people who are kind and contributive to the well-being of the community. Sadly, there are almost no people that share both those qualities on these forums anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:33, topic:269331”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=355441.msg2723005#msg2723005 date=1238111447]
Keep optimistic about the future or this community is deemed to fail.
[/quote]
No offense, but I think were already at that point. We had a chance to fix the horrible programming habits when 508 servers came out, but no one took action. Or those that did kept all their work private, and now we have slightly better but still horrible new engine servers.

History repeats itself.[/quote]

Not in the slightest. History does repeat itself, but in this very instance, history has not repeated itself to the same degree by even a long shot. This site is by far in a better state than it has ever been before, as I have said numerous times. Everyone here is too busy looking at the NOW instead of looking at the larger picture. It is this larger picture that matters. Studying what is happening now will not work as effective as looking at what has happened, what is happening, and attempting to predict what will happen before taking action.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is the community of this site so messed up?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

There is nothing to stop. This community isn’t a playground for kids. This community is meant to be a place where people can come and learn about programming private servers and the related. When it starts to move away from that is when you can start calling it a playground or whatever else. But until then, if then even comes, don’t bother. Keep optimistic about the future or this community is deemed to fail.

Read full topic
